AI Description: ResFinder is a web-based tool developed by the Center for Genomic Epidemiology for identification of acquired antimicrobial resistance genes in whole-genome sequencing data of bacterial isolates. It helps in predicting acquired antimicrobial resistance by comparing the input genome sequences to a set of known resistance genes.
Core Features: Identification Of Acquired Antimicrobial Resistance Genes, Analysis Of Whole-Genome Sequencing Data, Comparison Of Input Genome Sequences To A Database Of Known Resistance Genes, Prediction Of Antimicrobial Resistance
